Class CoopPlayerState

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.cooperateBattle.coopController.CoopPlayerState
public class CoopPlayerState extends Object
Per-player runtime state used by the cooperative game controller.

This class stores a player's generator, rotation helper, current offset and score. All shape/rotation/translation logic is performed here so the higher-level controller can remain focused on coordinating both players and the shared board matrix.

    • tryTranslate

      public boolean tryTranslate(int dx, int dy, int[][] boardMatrix, CoopPlayerState other, String ctx)
      Attempt to translate the player's current offset by (dx,dy).

      The method builds a temporary board that includes the other player's piece (if present) to perform collision checks. If the translation would collide the method returns false and leaves the offset unchanged.

      Returns:
      true if the translation was applied

    • tryRotate

      public boolean tryRotate(int[][] boardMatrix, CoopPlayerState other, String ctx)
      Attempt a rotation for the current brick using simple kick offsets.

      If a non-colliding rotation is found the rotation and any required offset (kick) is applied and true is returned. Otherwise the method returns false and the rotation is not applied.

      Returns:
      true if rotation succeeded

    • canMoveDown

      public boolean canMoveDown(int[][] boardMatrix)
      Check whether the player's active piece can move down by one row.
      Returns:
      true if the piece can move down

    • mergeIntoBoard

      public int[][] mergeIntoBoard(int[][] boardMatrix)
      Merge the player's current shape into the provided board matrix and return the resulting matrix. Caller must ensure offset is set.

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Create a ViewData instance representing the player's current falling piece (used by the renderer).

    • spawn

      public boolean spawn(int boardWidth, int[][] boardMatrix, CoopPlayerState other, int defaultXOffset)
      Spawn a new piece for this player using the generator and position it at the standard spawn coordinates (adjusted by defaultXOffset).
      Returns:
      true if the new piece immediately collides (spawn collision)
